Message.Title: Argument error
Message.Description: The optional argument has been used more than once in the same routine call.
Message.Actions: 1) Make sure the optional parameter is not used more than once in the same routine call.

Message.Title: Argument error
Message.Description: The argument has been specified for more than one parameter.
Message.Actions:
The parameter list, from which the parameter is selected, contains parameters mutually exclusive.
1) Make sure the argument is used for one parameter only.

Message.Title: Argument error
Message.Description: An argument for the required parameter was expected, but the optional argument was found.
Message.Actions: 1) Make sure all arguments are specified in the same order as the parameters for the routine called.

Message.Title: Argument error
Message.Description: The argument for REF parameter is not a data reference.
Message.Actions: 1) Make sure the argument is a data or a parameter reference.

Message.Title: Argument error
Message.Description: The argument for INOUT parameter is not a variable or persistent reference, or it is read-only.
Message.Actions:
1) Make sure the argument is a variable or a persistent variable parameter or a persistent parameter reference and that it is NOT read-only.
2) Also make sure the argument is NOT written within brackets ().

Message.Title: Argument error
Message.Description: Parameter is missing an optional argument value.
Message.Actions:
The only parameters that may be specified by a name only are "switch" parameters. All others must be assigned a value.
1) Make sure parameter has a value.

Message.Title: Argument error
Message.Description: The optional argument is not found in its correct position in the argument list.
Message.Actions: 1) Make sure all arguments are specified in the same order as the parameters for the routine called.

Message.Title: Argument error
Message.Description: A reference to the optional parameter is missing.
Message.Actions:
Each optional parameter must have a reference argument, specified with a leading backslash character (\).
1) Change the required argument into an optional argument.

Message.Title: Argument error
Message.Description: A reference to the required parameter in a conditional argument is missing.
Message.Actions:
Each conditional value for an optional parameter must refer to an optional parameter in the calling routine.
1) Change the conditional value.

Message.Title: Argument error
Message.Description: A reference to the required parameter in an optional argument is missing.
Message.Actions:
Each required parameter must have a reference argument, specified with a leading backslash character (\).
1) Change the optional argument into a required argument.

Message.Title: Argument error
Message.Description: The required argument is not found in its correct position in the argument list.
Message.Actions: Make sure all arguments are specified in the same order as the parameters for the routine called.

Message.Title: Argument error
Message.Description: The "switch" argument has a value.
Message.Causes: An argument corresponding to a "switch" parameter may not be assigned a value.
Message.Actions: 1) Remove the value.

Message.Title: Argument error
Message.Description: The call to routine has too few arguments.
Message.Actions:
A routine call must supply values for all required parameters of the routine being called. The argument list must have as many arguments, as the parameter list has parameters.
1) Add more arguments to fit the parameter list.

Message.Title: Argument error
Message.Description: The call to routine has too many arguments.
Message.Actions:
No arguments, more than those defined by the called routine parameter list, must be supplied. The argument list must have as many arguments, as the parameter list has parameters.
1) Remove excessive arguments from the argument list.

Message.Title: Data declaration error
Message.Description: The number of array dimensions is , but may be 1, 2 or 3 only.
Message.Actions: 1) Change the dimension expression.

Message.Title: Data declaration error
Message.Description: Too many dimensions in array definition.
Message.Actions:
An array may have at most 3 dimensions.
Rewrite the program so that no more than 3 dimensions are needed.

Message.Title: Type error
Message.Description: Indexed data , is not of array type.
Message.Actions:
Only data that have been declared to be arrays may be indexed.
1) Remove the index or indices.
2) Declare the data to be an array.

Message.Title: Type error
Message.Description: Data , is not of record type.
Message.Actions:
Components are only available for data of record type.
1) Check the type and name of the referenced data.

Message.Title: Limit error
Message.Description:
Task : Error when creating the persistent variable .
The error occurred when the persistent variable was to be inserted into the
database.
Program Ref.
Message.Consequences: The created persistent variable can not be used in a RAPID program.
Message.Causes: The program memory is full or fragmentated.
Message.Actions:
Check if large data structures could be split into smaller blocks.
Use of installed modules can save program memory.

Message.Title: Data declaration error
Message.Description: Expression is not a constant expression.
Message.Actions:
Any expression contained within a data declaration must be a constant expression.
1) Make sure no expression contains variables or persistent references, or function calls.

Message.Title: Instruction error
Message.Description: Missing expression in RETURN instruction.
Message.Causes: A RETURN instruction within a function must specify a value to be returned.
Message.Actions: 1) Add a value expression.

Message.Title: Type error
Message.Description: Illegal combination of operand types and for the '*' operator.
Message.Actions:
Allowed operand type combinations are: "num"*"num", "num"*"pos", "pos"*"num", "pos"*"pos" and "orient"*"orient".
1) Check the operand types.

Message.Title: Instruction error
Message.Description: Cannot transfer control into another instruction list.
Message.Actions:
It is not possible to jump into a program flow instruction.
1) Make sure that the label is located in the same instruction list as the GOTO instruction, at the same or an outer level.

Message.Title: Type error
Message.Description: Illegal type for left operand of binary '+' or '-' operator.
Message.Actions:
Allowed operand types for the binary "+" operator are "num", "pos" and "string", and for the binary "-" operator "num" and "pos".
1) Check the operand types.

Message.Title: Type error
Message.Description: Illegal type for operand of unary '+' or '-' operator.
Message.Actions:
Allowed operand types for the unary "+" and "-" operators are "num" and "pos".
1) Check the operand types.

Message.Title: Type error
Message.Description: Illegal type for right operand of binary '+' or '-' operator.
Message.Actions:
Allowed operand types for the binary "+" operator are "num", "pos" and "string", and for the binary "-" operator "num" and "pos".
1) Check the operand types.

Message.Title: Type error
Message.Description: Illegal type for left operand of '/', 'DIV' or 'MOD' operator.
Message.Actions:
Allowed operand type for the "/", "DIV" or "MOD" operators is "num".
1) Check the operand types.

Message.Title: Type error
Message.Description: Illegal type for right operand of '/', 'DIV' or 'MOD' operator.
Message.Actions:
Allowed operand type for the "/", "DIV" or "MOD" operators is "num".
1) Check the operand types.

Message.Title: Type error
Message.Description: Illegal type for left operand of '<', '<=', '>' or '>=' operator.
Message.Actions:
Allowed operand type for the "<", "<=", ">" or ">=" operators is "num".
1) Check the operand types.

Message.Title: Type error
Message.Description: Illegal type for right operand of '<', '<=', '>' or '>=' operator.
Message.Actions:
Allowed operand type for the "<", "<=", ">" or ">=" operators is "num".
1) Check the operand types.

Message.Title: Type error
Message.Description: Illegal type for left operand of '*' operator.
Message.Actions:
Allowed operand types for the "*" operator are "num", "pos" or "orient".
1) Check the operand types.

Message.Title: Type error
Message.Description: Illegal type for right operand of '*' operator.
Message.Actions:
Allowed operand types for the "*" operator are "num", "pos" or "orient".
1) Check the operand types.

Message.Title: Type error
Message.Description: Illegal type for operand of 'NOT' operator.
Message.Actions:
Allowed operand type for the "NOT" operator is "bool".
1) Check the operand types.

Message.Title: Type error
Message.Description: Illegal type for left operand of 'OR', 'XOR' or 'AND' operator.
Message.Actions:
Allowed operand type for the "OR", "XOR" or "AND" operators is "bool".
1) Check the operand types.

Message.Title: Type error
Message.Description: Illegal type for right operand of 'OR', 'XOR' or 'AND' operator.
Message.Actions:
Allowed operand type for the "OR", "XOR" or "AND" operators is "bool".
1) Check the operand types.

Message.Title: Type error
Message.Description: Incorrect number of indices in index list for array with dimension(s).
Message.Actions: 1) Make sure that the number of indices in the index list corresponds to the number of dimensions of the indexed data array.

Message.Title: Data declaration error
Message.Description: LOCAL illegal in routine constant declaration.
Message.Actions: Only program data declarations may have the LOCAL attribute. Remove the LOCAL attribute or move the declaration outside of the routine.

Message.Title: Data declaration error
Message.Description: LOCAL illegal in routine variable declaration
Message.Actions: Only program data declarations may have the LOCAL attribute. Remove the LOCAL attribute or move the declaration outside of the routine.

Message.Title: Name error
Message.Description: Constant name ambiguous.
Message.Actions: Routine data must have names that are unique within the routine. Program data must have names that are unique within the module. Rename the data or change the conflicting name.

Message.Title: Name error
Message.Description: Global constant name ambiguous.
Message.Actions: Global data must have names that are unique among all the global types, data, global routines and modules in the entire program. Rename the data or change the conflicting name.

Message.Title: Name error
Message.Description: Global persistent name ambiguous.
Message.Actions: Global data must have names that are unique among all the global types, data, global routines and modules in the entire program. Rename the data or change the conflicting name.

Message.Title: Name error
Message.Description: Global routine name ambiguous.
Message.Actions: Global routines must have names that are unique among all the global types, data, global routines and modules in the entire program. Rename the routine or change the conflicting name.

Message.Title: Name error
Message.Description: Global variable name ambiguous.
Message.Actions: Global data must have names that are unique among all the global types, data, global routines and modules in the entire program. Rename the data or change the conflicting name.

Message.Title: Name error
Message.Description: Label name ambiguous.
Message.Actions: Labels must have names that are unique within the routine. Rename the label or change the conflicting name.

Message.Title: Name error
Message.Description: Module name ambiguous.
Message.Actions: Modules must have names that are unique among all the global types, global data, global routines and modules in the entire program. Rename the module or change the conflicting name.

Message.Title: Name error
Message.Description: Parameter name ambiguous.
Message.Actions: Parameters must have names that are unique within the routine. Rename the parameter or change the conflicting name.

Message.Title: Name error
Message.Description: Persistent name ambiguous
Message.Actions: Program data must have names that are unique within the module. Rename the data or change the conflicting name.

Message.Title: Name error
Message.Description: Routine name ambiguous.
Message.Actions: Routines must have names that are unique within the module. Rename the routine or change the conflicting name.

Message.Title: Name error
Message.Description: Variable name ambiguous.
Message.Actions: Routine data must have names that are unique within the routine. Program data must have names that are unique within the module. Rename the data or change the conflicting name.

Message.Title: Type error
Message.Description: Operand types and for binary '+' or '-' operator not equal
Message.Actions: The two operands of the '+' and '-' operators must have equal type. Check the operand types.

Message.Title: Type error
Message.Description: Operand types and for '=' or '<>' operator not equal
Message.Actions: The two operands of the '=' and '<>' operators must have equal type. Check the operand types.

Message.Title: Instruction error
Message.Description: RETURN with expression only allowed in function
Message.Actions: In a procedure or trap the return instruction must not specify a return value expression. Remove the expression.

Message.Title: Type error
Message.Description: Different dimension of array type () and aggregate ()
Message.Actions: Make sure that the number of expressions in the aggregate is the same as the dimension of the data array.

Message.Title: Type error
Message.Description: Assignment target type is not value or semi-value type.
Message.Actions: The type, of the data to be assigned a value, must be a value or semi-value type. Data of non-value types may only be set by special type specific predefined instructions or functions.

Message.Title: Type error
Message.Description: Type for left operand of '=' or '<>' operator not value or semi-value type
Message.Actions: The '=' and '<>' operators may only be applied to expressions of value or semi-value type. If comparisons are to be made, special type specific predefined functions are needed.

Message.Title: Type error
Message.Description: Type for right operand of '=' or '<>' operator not value or semi-value type
Message.Actions: The '=' and '<>' operators may only be applied to expressions of value or semi-value type. If comparisons are to be made, special type specific predefined functions are needed.

Message.Title: Type error
Message.Description: TEST expression type not value or semi-value type
Message.Actions: The TEST instruction may only be applied to an expression of value or semi-value type. If comparisons are to be made, special type specific predefined functions are needed.

Message.Title: Data declaration error
Message.Description: Place holder for value expression not allowed in definition of named constant
Message.Actions: Complete the data declaration or change the data name to a place holder.

Message.Title: Data declaration error
Message.Description: Place holder for array dimension not allowed in definition of named constant or variable
Message.Actions: Complete the data declaration or change the data name to a place holder.

Message.Title: Routine declaration error
Message.Description: Place holder for parameter array dimensions not allowed in definition of named routine
Message.Actions: Complete the parameter declaration or change the routine name to a place holder.

Message.Title: Name error
Message.Description: Place holder for parameter name not allowed in definition of named routine
Message.Actions: Complete the routine declaration or change the routine name to a place holder.

Message.Title: Data declaration error
Message.Description: Place holder for initial value expression not allowed in definition of named persistent
Message.Actions: Complete the data declaration or change the data name to a place holder.

Message.Title: Routine declaration error
Message.Description: Place holder for parameter not allowed in definition of named routine
Message.Actions: Complete the parameter declaration, remove the place holder or change the routine name to a place holder.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description: Place holder for type not allowed in definition of named data, record component or routine
Message.Actions: Complete the data or routine declaration or change the data or routine name to a place holder.

Message.Title: Data declaration error
Message.Description: Place holder for initial value expression not allowed in definition of named variable
Message.Actions: Complete the data declaration or change the data name to a place holder.

Message.Title: Type error
Message.Description: Too few components in record aggregate of type
Message.Actions: Make sure that the number of expressions in the aggregate is the same as the number of components in the record type.

Message.Title: Type error
Message.Description: Too many components in record aggregate of type
Message.Actions: Make sure that the number of expressions in the aggregate is the same as the number of components in the record type.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description: Data reference is ambiguous
Message.Actions: At least one other object sharing the same name as the referred data is visible from this program position. Make sure that all object names fulfill the naming rules regarding uniqueness.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description: function reference is ambiguous
Message.Actions: At least one other object sharing the same name as the referred function is visible from this program position. Make sure that all object names fulfill the naming rules regarding uniqueness.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description: Label reference is ambiguous
Message.Actions: At least one other object sharing the same name as the referred label is visible from this program position. Make sure that all object names fulfill the naming rules regarding uniqueness.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description: Procedure reference is ambiguous
Message.Actions: At least one other object sharing the same name as the referred procedure is visible from this program position. Make sure that all object names fulfill the naming rules regarding uniqueness.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description: Trap reference is ambiguous.
Message.Actions:
At least one other object sharing the
same name as the referred trap is
visible from this program position. Make
sure that all object names fulfill the
naming rules regarding uniqueness.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description: not entire data reference
Message.Actions:
The specified name identifies an object
other than data. Check if the desired
data is hidden by some other object with
the same name.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description: not function reference
Message.Actions:
The specified name identifies an object
other than a function. Check if the
desired function is hidden by some other
object with the same name.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description: not label reference
Message.Actions:
The specified name identifies an object
other than a label. Check if the desired
label is hidden by some other object
with the same name.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description:
not optional parameter reference in
conditional argument value
Message.Actions:
The specified name identifies an object
other than an optional parameter. Change
the name to refer to an optional
parameter.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description: not optional parameter reference
Message.Actions:
The specified name identifies an object
other than an optional parameter. Change
the name to refer to an optional
parameter.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description: Task : is not a procedure reference
Message.Actions:
The specified name identifies an object
other than a procedure. Check if the
desired procedure is hidden by some
other object with the same name.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description: not required parameter reference
Message.Actions:
The specified name identifies an object
other than a required parameter. Change
the name to refer to a required
parameter.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description: not trap reference
Message.Actions:
The specified name identifies an object
other than a trap. Check if the desired
trap is hidden by some other object with
the same name.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description: not type name
Message.Actions:
The specified name identifies an object
other than a type. Check if the desired
type is hidden by some other object with
the same name.

Message.Title: Type error
Message.Description: not value type
Message.Actions:
Only variables that lack initial value,
and 'VAR' mode parameters may be of
semi-value or non-value type.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description:
Reference to
unknown label
Message.Actions:
The routine contains no label (or other
object) with the specified name.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description:
Reference to
unknown optional parameter
Message.Actions:
The called routine contains no optional
parameter (or other object) with the
specified name.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description:
Reference to
unknown record component
Message.Actions:
The record type contains no record
component with the specified name.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description:
Reference to
unknown required parameter
Message.Actions:
The called routine contains no required
parameter (or other object) with the
specified name.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description: Unknown type name
Message.Actions:
No data type (or other object) with the
specified name is visible from this
program position.

Message.Title: Instruction error
Message.Description:
Assignment target
is read only
Message.Actions:
The data to be assigned a value may not
be a constant, read only variable or
read only persistent.

Message.Title: Data declaration error
Message.Description:
Persistent
declaration not allowed in routine
Message.Actions:
Persistents may only be declared at
module level. Move the persistent
declaration from the routine.

Message.Title: Instruction error
Message.Description:
RAISE without
expression only allowed in error handler
Message.Actions:
Add an error number expression to the
RAISE instruction.

Message.Title: Instruction error
Message.Description:
RETRY only
allowed in error handler
Message.Actions:
The RETRY instruction may only be used
in error handlers. Remove it.

Message.Title: Instruction error
Message.Description:
TRYNEXT only
allowed in error handler
Message.Actions:
The TRYNEXT instruction may only be used
in error handlers. Remove it.

Message.Title: Parameter error
Message.Description:
'switch'
parameter must have transfer mode IN
Message.Actions:
Remove the parameter transfer mode
specifier. If IN transfer mode is not
sufficient, change the data type of the
parameter.

Message.Title: Parameter error
Message.Description:
'switch'
parameter cannot be dimensioned
Message.Actions:
Remove the array dimension
specification, or change the data type
of the parameter.

Message.Title: Parameter error
Message.Description:
'switch' only
allowed for optional parameter
Message.Actions:
Change the parameter into an optional
parameter, or change the data type of
the parameter. If the object is not a
parameter, change the data type.

Message.Title: Type error
Message.Description:
Type mismatch of
expected type and
found type
Message.Actions:
The expression is not of the expected
data type.

Message.Title: Type error
Message.Description:
Type mismatch of
aggregate, expected type
Message.Actions:
The aggregate does not match the
expected data type.

Message.Title: Type error
Message.Description:
Persistent
, type
mismatch
Message.Actions:
There is already a persistent data with
the same name but with another data
type. Rename the persistent, or change
its data type.

Message.Title: Data declaration error
Message.Description:
Cannot determine
array dimensions (circular constant
references ?)
Message.Actions:
Check that any referred constants are
correctly defined. If so, the program is
too complex. Try to rewrite the
declarations.

Message.Title: Data declaration error
Message.Description:
Cannot determine
type of constant value (circular
constant references ?)
Message.Actions:
Check that any referred constants are
correctly defined. If so, the program is
too complex. Try to rewrite the
declarations.

Message.Title: Data declaration error
Message.Description:
Cannot evaluate
constant value expression (circular
constant references ?)
Message.Actions:
Check that any referred constants are
correctly defined. If so, the program is
too complex. Try to rewrite the
declarations.
